summary: This has been a colossal effort.
descriptionHtml:
[size=9][b][color=#FF6666]Blood, Sweat and Tears[/color][/b][/size]
[size=6][b]A Hyper-Fantastical[/b][/size]
[size=6][b]ENB + Realistic Lighting Config[/b][/size]

This configuration aims for a pseudo-realistic fantasy vibe. Think: Warm, purpley-orange sunny days with soft indirect illumination, and dark nights where torches and stars stand out like beacons. It won't be for everyone, but I have a feeling it will find a place in someone's heart.

[size=4][b][u]Installation:[/b][/u][/size]
1) Install ENBseries ([url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0113.htm]v0.113[/url]) to your Skyrim folder. [size=3][color=#FF6666]*[/color][/size]
2) Copy Included "realistic lighting" files to your Skyrim Data folder.
3) Enable all realistic lighting mods in Launcher or Mod Manager.

[size=3][color=#FF6666]*[/color][/size] Built/tested on ENB 0.113 !!

[size=4][b][u]Alternate Color Palette:[/b][/u][/size]
Just in case you hate the bloomy, fantasy colors, I have included an alternate, normal color palette, too.
1) Rename enbpalette.bmp -> enbpalette-bak.bmp
2) Rename enbpalette-alternate.bmp -> enbpalette.bmp

////////////////////////////////////

[size=4][b][u]Source Mod Info + Credit:[/u][/b][/size]
[i]ENBseries Skyrim 0.112 @ [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0112.htm]http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0112.htm[/url][/i]
[i]Realistic Lighting @ [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/7654]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/7654[/url][/i]

[size=4][b][u]Hardware Tested:[/u][/b][/size]
AMD 6870 + Phenom II X4 965BE
[size=4][b][u]Also tested:[/u][/b][/size]
Nvidia GTX 670 + I5-2300

[size=4][b][u]Bugfixes + News:[/u][/b][/size]
Forthcoming testing/corresponding release for Nvidia users.
Testing and updates for newest ENB (V 0.126)
author: EE1213
